meanings.definition: Receiving good from uncertain or unexpected sources.
meanings.sent1: She felt fortunate to find money in an old jacket pocket.
meanings.sent2: The fortunate winner of the raffle was ecstatic.
meanings.sent3: It was fortunate that she remembered her umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The fortunate discovery of a rare coin brought joy to the collector.
meanings.sent5: The fortunate turn of events saved the day for the stranded travelers.

meanings.sent1: He considered himself fortunate to have such caring friends.
meanings.sent2: The fortunate student aced the exam without studying much.
meanings.sent3: It was fortunate that the bus arrived just as it started to rain.
meanings.sent4: The fortunate coincidence of meeting his old friend made his day.
meanings.sent5: The fortunate timing of the job offer was a relief after months of searching.

meanings.definition: Bringing some good thing not foreseen as certain.
meanings.sent1: The fortunate news of a promotion came unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: She felt fortunate to receive a surprise gift from her colleague.
meanings.sent3: It was fortunate that the cake turned out delicious despite the burnt edges.
meanings.sent4: The fortunate arrival of a taxi just as it started to pour saved her from getting wet.
meanings.sent5: The fortunate opportunity to travel abroad opened up new possibilities for her career.
